listitem.para: Use Aggressive Mode instead of Main Mode. Aggressive Mode is less secure, and vulnerable to Denial Of Service attacks. It is also vulnerable to brute force attacks with software such as ikecrack. It should not be used, and it should especially not be used with XAUTH and group secrets (PSK). If the remote system administrator insists on staying irresponsible, enable this option.

Aggressive Mode is further limited to only one proposal - there is no room for negotation. Therefor it is mandatory for Aggressive Mode connections that both ike= and esp= options are specified with exactly one fully specified proposal. Acceptable values are yes or no (the default).
